metadata.title: CVE-2014-0165 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 3.7.2 and 3.8.x before 3.8.2 allows remote authenticatedusers to publish posts by leveraging the Contributor role, related towp-admin/includes/post.php andwp-admin/includes/class-wp-posts-list-table.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.8.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.8.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.8.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.8.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwelve - 3.8.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.2+dfsg-1').
